availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Commodore P. Kinman (Harrison County, KY, farmer and soldier (58th Ind. Inf.))

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, and Pike County, Indiana, farmer and soldier. Indiana native. Married to Louisa Kinman. Father of Jesse Kinman and Eliza Kinman. Laborer in Bainbridge, Indiana, in 1850. Farmer in Jefferson in 1860. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1863. Served in the 58th Indiana Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Dubois County, Bainbridge, p. 493B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Pike County, Jefferson, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cutland, p. 236A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June & July 1863, p. 227.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Certificate #264049.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Harrison County Wills, vol. L-O, 1882-1942, p. 165.
